result.execSummary:
The defendant Shane T. Striepling was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Probation may transfer to Waukesha County.

miscConds.notes:
Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.
----------------------------------

IT IS HEREBY ORDERED THAT the defendant's excess work release funds be applied to any & all outstanding Court obligations while serving his mandatory jail sentence.
------------------------

No alcohol.   No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Any prescribed medications must be made known to Agent. Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.
------------------------

Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent. The defendant must pay Department of Corrections Supervision fees.
------------------------

AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations.
------------------------

Pay $500.00 fine plus costs.   Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for two (2) years.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
------------------------

timeConds.notes: with work release privileges to commence on or before March 9th at 6:00 pm. Conditional Jail time may be served in Waukesha County.

supervisions.notes: Probation may transfer to Waukesha County.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shane T. Striepling

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
2:28 pm  Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given.  
Matthew R. Leusink appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant Shane T. Striepling in court with attorney Matthew Huppertz.  
Matter is before the Court for plea and sentencing.  
Parties have a joint agreement.  
Attorney Huppertz recites terms of agreement.  
Court has plea colloquy with Mr. Striepling.  
Court finds deft competent to enter a plea.  

2:34 pm  Deft enters GUILTY pleas to Counts #1 and #2
Count #3 is dismissed and read-in.  
Court has reviewed the facts of the Criminal Complaint and finds a factual basis exists for accepting plea and adjudges the defendant guilty.
Statement by Attorney Huppertz
Court will adopt the recommendation of the parties.  

Withheld sentence, TWO (2) years probation - May be transferred to Waukesha County
Conditions of probation:
ON COUNT #1:  Ten (10) days Jail with work release privileges to commence on or before March 9th at 6:00 PM
Conditional Jail time may be served in Waukesha County
ON COUNT #1:  $500.00 fine plus court costs
ON COUNT #2:  Court costs only
AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations
Other counseling as recommended
No Weapons
No Alcohol.  No drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Any prescribed medications must be made known to Agent.  
Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid license.  
Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge.  
ONE (1) day sentence credit if probation is revoked.  

Before the Court will quash the Defendant's bond, the Defendant is required to:  
1)  Immediately set up a payment plan with the Clerk of Courts and
2)  Report to jail tomorrow at 6:00 p.m. for his conditional jail time.  

2:41 pm  Court in recess.

Defendant Shane T. Striepling in court with attorney Matthew Huppertz.  Daniel A. Necci appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 8, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Shane T. Striepling in court with attorney Matthew Huppertz.  Matthew R. Leusink appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Bond Remains. Minutes filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 3, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Shane T. Striepling appeared with Atty Mark Powers. Tracy L. McMiller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Not guilty plea entered. Minutes filed.  Status conference scheduled for November 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.  Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.

Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Defendant will not possess any guns or other weapons.  Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
15-3570 thru 15-3572
Defendant in cout in custody with attorney Travis Schwantes. Diane Donohoo appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Minutes filed.
